Name: Headless statue of Shepses-Ptah and wife
Description: Pair statue from the mastaba of Shepses-Ptah in Giza. Both heads as well as the left upper arm and upper body of the wife are missing. On the right shoulder of the wife are still traces of her striated wig. Her right arm is around her husband. She is wearing a long close-fitting garment. She has decorative bands around her arms and ankles.The arms of the man are pendant with the hands fisted. The white apron-fronted kilt reaches to just above the knee. The rectangular back plate ends near the waist of the figures. The accompanying texts are carved on the base.
